page.title: 03ECOLOGY AND NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: Land rises to 122m. N.E. of West Wickham. Lowest point 83m. N.W. of West Wickham, where there are disused chalk pits (Now being filled). Undulating farmland, interspersed by small deciduous and mixed woods of 1-3 hectares. Evidence of the removal of hedges. Hedges bordering the roads of blackthorn, elder, hawthorn, etc.. Little evidence of wild flowers. Small mammals such as hares, bats, foxes and snipe have been seen, also bred pheasants,horses,goats,falcons. There are 17 kilometers of foot- paths in the region although these are not always accessible, due to farmers ploughing them up. Pollution problems include noise from low flying military aircraft, some stubble burning and aerial spray- ing of crops. This is generally a dry cold area.
